intro: Psychotria goodii, commonly known as the "Kampango" or "Bamboo Psychotria," is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, bamboo-like stems and small, elliptical leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers, which are followed by dark red berries. Psychotria goodii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
